history.content:
The prerequisites for EE 130 are now EE 16 A & B. See below and here.

Most classes that previously listed EE 40 or 20 as pre-reqs now list both EE 16 A & B. I will let the faculty comment on the relationship between the old and new series, however there is not a clear-cut 40=16A or 20=16B.

EL ENG 130 Integrated-Circuit Devices 4 Units

Offered through: Electrical Engin and Computer Sci
Terms offered: 2016 Spring, 2015 Fall
Overview of electronic properties of semiconductor. Metal-semiconductor contacts, pn junctions, bipolar transistors, and MOS field-effect transistors. Properties that are significant to device operation for integrated circuits. Silicon device fabrication technology. 

Rules & Requirements

Prerequisites: EE 16A and 16B

Credit Restrictions: Students will receive no credit for El Eng 130 after taking El Eng 230A.

Hours & Format

Fall and/or spring: 15 weeks - 3 hours of lecture and 1 hour of discussion per week

Additional Details

Subject/Course Level: Electrical Engineering/Undergraduate

Grading/Final exam status: Letter grade. Final exam required.

The prerequisites for EE 130 are now EE 16 & B. See below and here.

EL ENG 130 Integrated-Circuit Devices 4 Units

Offered through: Electrical Engin and Computer Sci
Terms offered: 2016 Spring, 2015 Fall
Overview of electronic properties of semiconductor. Metal-semiconductor contacts, pn junctions, bipolar transistors, and MOS field-effect transistors. Properties that are significant to device operation for integrated circuits. Silicon device fabrication technology. 

Rules & Requirements

Prerequisites: EE 16A and 16B

Credit Restrictions: Students will receive no credit for El Eng 130 after taking El Eng 230A.

Hours & Format

Fall and/or spring: 15 weeks - 3 hours of lecture and 1 hour of discussion per week

Additional Details

Subject/Course Level: Electrical Engineering/Undergraduate

Grading/Final exam status: Letter grade. Final exam required.

I took EE40, not 16a, but I will say that in 130 they usually don't test you on any circuits knowledge- it's all about the semiconductor physics/concepts.  That being said, you should have a general idea of KVL/KCL, some very basic AC circuit knowledge, and an idea of what a diode/mosfet is, just so that you know why this is even important in the first place (a quick wikipedia search should be satisfactory).  So, if you are interested in 130, I think you should just go for it!

I'm thinking about taking EE130, which lists EE40 as a prerequisite.  I have taken EE16A, and will be taking EE16B next semester.  What is the relationship between EE20, EE40, and the new classes, in terms of prereqs?
history.subject: EE Prereqs
